unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Getting a Sunny Update!**
normalised: **energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies getting a sunny update!**

unnormalised: Good news for homeowners looking to ditch reliance on the grid and embrace Surya Dev! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is reportedly revamping the rooftop solar subsidy scheme. Think 'Lagaan' but instead of taxes, you're saving money!
normalised: good news for homeowners looking to ditch reliance on the grid and embrace surya dev! the ministry of new and renewable energy is reportedly revamping the rooftop solar subsidy scheme. think 'lagaan' but instead of taxes, you're saving money!

unnormalised: Sources say the subsidies for installations up to 3kW could see a boost. Apparently, folks in Mumbai are saying installation costs are still a bit much, especially considering the Ganpati celebrations are around the corner and wallets are already feeling light.
normalised: sources say the subsidies for installations up to three kilowatt could see a boost. apparently, folks in mumbai are saying installation costs are still a bit much, especially considering the ganpati celebrations are around the corner and wallets are already feeling light.

unnormalised: The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) is expected to play a key role in disbursing these revised subsidies. Imagine a scenario like 'Rocket Boys' but with panels instead of rockets!
normalised: the I R E D A is expected to play a key role in disbursing these revised subsidies. imagine a scenario like 'rocket boys' but with panels instead of rockets!

unnormalised: The new scheme might also simplify the application process - no more complicated forms that would make even a chartered accountant cry! This could mean faster approvals and more homes powered by the sun. One estimate suggests a potential saving of around Rs. 30,000 per year on electricity bills for a 2kW system in Delhi. Let's hope this initiative lights up the lives of many! More updates to follow!
normalised: the new scheme might also simplify the application process - no more complicated forms that would make even a chartered accountant cry! this could mean faster approvals and more homes powered by the sun. one estimate suggests a potential saving of around rupees thirty thousand per year on electricity bills for a two kilowatt system in delhi. let's hope this initiative lights up the lives of many! more updates to follow!
